metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5549 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The klsi_105_get_line_state function in drivers/usb/serial/kl5kusb105.c in the Linux kernel before 4.9.5 places uninitialized heap-memory contents into a log entry upon a failure to read the line status, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading the log. It was discovered that the KLSI KL5KUSB105 serial-to-USB device driver in the Linux kernel did not properly initialize memory related to logging. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5549` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-63-generic - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-lowlatency - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-4.4.0-63-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-63.84
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-63-generic - 4.4.0-63.84
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-63.84').

linux-azure package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.0-1009.9').
